definition: to change direction/fig. to change one's stance
to get lost/to lose one's way
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...
to tend toward/to guide/variant of 向[xiang4]
variant of 向[xiang4]/direction/orientation/to face/to turn toward/to/towards/shortly before/formerly

sentences.english: Moses manages to placate God momentarily, and then he turns around to face the people.
sentences.chinese: 摩西想马上安抚上帝，他把脸转向人民。

sentences.english: It looks like the momentum is growing for a shift towards stream-oriented approach to UI.
sentences.chinese: 看起来UI转向面向数据流方式的势头渐劲。

sentences.english: Yet it is only recently that we have truly turned from a whaling civilization to a whale-watching one.
sentences.chinese: 但我们真正从一种捕鲸文明转向观鲸文明还是在最近。

sentences.english: The former russian satellite now turn to the west for help.
sentences.chinese: 从前俄国的卫星国现在转向西方要求援助。

sentences.english: Heir to an industrial past, the region has turned towards tourism.
sentences.chinese: 曾经工业的继承者，而如今这里已转向旅游业。

sentences.english: If you pivot in another direction, the app follows.
sentences.chinese: 如果你转向另一个方向，它也会随着变化。

sentences.english: He turned back to the queen's knights.
sentences.chinese: 他回身转向王后的骑士。

sentences.english: And this is only Google to enterprise-class start.
sentences.chinese: 而这只是谷歌转向企业级的开始。

sentences.english: The science view is changing, forming technoscience view.
sentences.chinese: 它是科学观的一次转向，形成了技性科学观。

sentences.english: An intelligent electric power steering system was designed.
sentences.chinese: 设计了一种智能电动式电子控制动力转向系统。

sentences.english: He turned to the audience with an embarrassed sigh.
sentences.chinese: 他转向听众并发出了窘迫的叹息声。

sentences.english: Urban planning from two-dimensional arrangement to three-dimensional planning began long time ago.
sentences.chinese: 城市规划由平面的布置转向三维的规划，历史源远。

sentences.english: The directional signal switch is installed just below the hub of the steering wheel.
sentences.chinese: 转向开关就安装在转向柱毂的下面。

sentences.english: The directional signal switch is installed just below the hub of the steering wheel.
sentences.chinese: 转向开关就安装在转向柱毂的下面。

sentences.english: You have made your way around this hill country long enough; now turn north.
sentences.chinese: 你们绕行这山的日子够了，要转向北去。

sentences.english: In order to get next to a dock, a vessel had to turn its rudder to the outside.
sentences.chinese: 为了靠上码头，船只必须将船舵转向外侧。

definition: to turn to (sth else)/to switch to
to point towards/aimed at/facing/the direction indicated
direction/strike (i.e. angle of inclination in geology)/inclination/trend/to move towards/to head for
to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
to drive/to propel/drive (vehicle wheel)/drive mechanism (tape or disk)/device driver (computing software)
to shift/to divert or distract (attention etc)/to change/to transform/metastasis (medicine)/to evacuate (people)
partial towards sth/to prefer/to incline/erroneous tendencies (Leftist or Revisionist deviation)
